title: Shangri La Hotel Logos
content:
I realize that the typefaces for this are custom made, but anything similar would be appreciated as this is the style that we are looking for.

As the logo images are white over transparent PNG files (which may be difficult or impossible to see) I am linking to the actual location.

[http://www.shangri-la.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131010508/http:/www.shangri-la.com/)

[http://www.shangri-la.com/en/property/vancouver/shangrila](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131010508/http:/www.shangri-la.com/en/property/vancouver/shangrila)

In my own research, the closest font that I have come across is Connach and Connach Historic.

Any help, tips would be appreciated. Thank you!
author: whitehat

comments.content:
This version is 'Optima'

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131010508im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Shangri-La_3704.jpg)

This version I'm not sure on.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131010508im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Shangri-La-02_4433.jpg)
Great ID on the first one, thank you, and a fantastic blow up of the second. May I inquire as to the source of the image?

Creative NRG - The top SHANGRI-LA isn't Optima, it's a slightly customized TF Arrow. The VANCOUVER bit is Optima.

Nick Cooke

Kingthings has the same feel: [LINK](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131010508/http:/www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/list/style/Calligraphic)  
Does the logo look a little off with the "h" in "hotel" uncapitalized?

Or, you might check myfonts.com for those tagged with calligraphy: [LINK](http://web.archive.org/web/20150131010508/http:/new.myfonts.com/tags/calligraphy/)

Thanks Nick!

I stand corrected. That's what I get for doing a quick ID without taking the time to find a better source.
You guys have been wonderful help. I thank you very much and stand amazed at what this board is capable of. Cheers!
